security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure documentation guide containing only informational content about Docusaurus configuration. The static analysis flagged 34 pattern-based findings, but evaluation confirms ALL are false positives: the 'hardcoded URLs' are repository metadata, 'C2 keywords' refer to content hash fields, 'weak cryptographic algorithms' are SHA-256 integrity hashes, and 'shell backticks' are documentation file path references. No executable code, command execution, or credential exfiltration exists.

content.value_statement: Documentation teams struggle to customize Docusaurus sites beyond basic setup. This skill provides deep guidance on plugins, theme customization, and MDX integration for advanced documentation sites.
actual_capabilities: Explain Docusaurus configuration structure and best practices
Guide plugin and preset selection and setup
Assist with theme swizzling and custom CSS overrides
Provide guidance on MDX component integration
Help configure custom fields and API exposure
Support sidebar organization and navigation design
limitations: Does not modify files or execute Docusaurus build commands
Does not provide debugging support for build errors
Cannot generate complete documentation sites from scratch

prompt_templates.title: Basic Configuration Help
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the structure of docusaurus.config.ts and how to configure the basic settings for a documentation site.

prompt_templates.title: Plugin Selection Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: What plugins and presets are available in Docusaurus and how do I configure the classic preset for docs, blog, and pages?

prompt_templates.title: Theme Customization
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I customize the Docusaurus theme using CSS overrides and theme swizzling? What files should I modify?

prompt_templates.title: MDX Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I use MDX to create interactive documentation components in Docusaurus? Provide examples of embedded React components.

output_examples.input: How do I configure a custom API URL in Docusaurus?
output: Expose the API URL via customFields in your docusaurus.config.ts
Set environment variable: DOCUSAURUS_API_URL or use default
Access in client-side components via themeConfig.apiUrl
Configure AuthBar navbar item for authenticated sections

output_examples.input: What is theme swizzling and when should I use it?
output: Theme swizzling replaces Docusaurus theme components with custom versions
Use it when CSS overrides are not sufficient for your customization needs
Create component in src/theme/ComponentName to override
Avoid modifying node_modules directly to prevent upgrade issues

output_examples.input: How do I organize my documentation sidebar?
output: Define sidebar structure in sidebars.ts for consistent navigation
Use autogenerated sidebars for automatic index creation
Group related docs using category nodes
Enable collapsible categories for better user experience

best_practices: Use the classic preset for standard documentation sites with docs, blog, and pages
Keep custom CSS in textbook/src/css/custom.css for clean theme overrides
Define sidebars in sidebars.ts for consistent navigation across your site
anti_patterns: Avoid modifying Docusaurus source files directly; use theme swizzling instead
Do not hardcode API URLs; use environment variables for different deployments
Avoid skipping sidebar configuration; it leads to inconsistent navigation

faq.question: What versions of Docusaurus are supported?
faq.answer: This skill covers Docusaurus v2 and v3 configurations. Core concepts apply across versions.

faq.question: Can this skill generate a complete Docusaurus site?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides configuration guidance but cannot create files or run commands.

faq.question: How do I add custom fields to my configuration?
faq.answer: Add customFields to your docusaurus.config.ts. These are exposed to client components.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads information and provides guidance. No files are modified.

faq.question: Why is my build failing after configuration changes?
faq.answer: Check config syntax, verify plugin compatibility, and ensure required dependencies are installed.

faq.question: How does this compare to the basic Docusaurus skill?
faq.answer: The advanced skill covers plugins, theme swizzling, and MDX. The basic skill covers initial setup.
